title: (x) Clue board game logo - Novel Gothic {James}
content:
Actually, I don't need the actual font, just something close. Any ideas?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [File](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022615/http:/typophile.com/files/drupal_6) | 41.53 KB |
author: Peter G.

comments.content:
[**ITC Kabel Ultra**](http://web.archive.org/web/20150330022615/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.68.0.5&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Clue&sampleSize=96&attributes.paraSize=14&paraSize=14) is sorta close.

I found a closer match in an old Photo-Lettering, Inc. sample book, but the typeface is referenced by a number and not a name.

Parker Bros., originally in Salem, Mass., had a big in-house design and ad agency in its heyday. The game "Clue" probably pre-dates ITC which was founded in 1970, so if the game graphics hasn't been updated since then, it was probably done on using photo headline font.

-------------------------------------------  
Yes, I'm old, but I'm back in style!

Many thanks.

It's actually just for my sister, who wants to do some kind of Clue-themed game on her floor at school. So Kabel Ultra should work just fine.
_Little Sister, with the candelstick, in the pantry!_
Novel Gothic. Typo in my post.
